etymologies: 1930s. From the name of Allan Brugh Dick, Scottish chemical metallurgist, who discovered and described this mineral + -ite

definitions: A clay mineral related to kaolinite, typically white in colour, which occurs as pseudohexagonal crystals, aggregates of platelets, and in compact massive form.

notes.text: Dickite is a silicate of aluminium, Al₂Si₂O₅(OH)₄, with a phyllosilicate structure. Crystal system: monoclinic.
